intro: Aspidogyne grandis, commonly known as the large aspidogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain one or two seeds. Aspidogyne grandis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
